page.title: 18LEGEND OF BISHOP AUCKLAND-1
page.content: Once a fierce wild boar so terrorized the land about Bishop Auckland that the Bishop offered a huge reward for its capture. No-one was brave enough except a young man named Pollard who decided to try his luck. He decided that the boar was too fierce to be beaten by strength, so he followed it for many days and found where and when it ate. One day he hid in a tree where it fed and when it had filled itself it went to sleep. He promptly attacked it and a fierce battle followed. He at last killed the boar but was so tired that he simply cut out its tongue as proff of his victory. Whilst he slept, a stranger found the boar dead and, not seeing Pollard, cut off its head and took it to the Bishop to claim the reward. {(continued on Page 19)}
